entries.title: Mitochondrion
entries.summary: Energy-producing organelle found in most eukaryotic cells. Site of oxidative phosphorylation and ATP production.
entries.content:
Structure

Mitochondria have a double membrane with folded cristae; they contain their own DNA.

Function

Produce ATP, regulate apoptosis, and maintain metabolic homeostasis.

Clinical relevance

Mitochondrial dysfunction underlies metabolic disorders and neurodegeneration.

entries.title: Nucleus
entries.summary: Membrane-bound organelle that stores the cell's genetic material and coordinates gene expression.
entries.content:
Structure

Double-membrane nuclear envelope with nuclear pores; contains chromatin and nucleolus.

Function

Houses DNA, regulates transcription, and assembles ribosomal subunits.

entries.title: Lysosome
entries.summary: Acidic organelle containing hydrolytic enzymes for intracellular degradation and recycling.
entries.content:
Function

Degrades macromolecules from endocytosis and autophagy; defects cause lysosomal storage diseases.

entries.title: Diabetes Mellitus
entries.summary: A group of metabolic disorders characterized by high blood glucose due to defects in insulin secretion, action, or both.
entries.content:
Types

Type 1 (autoimmune beta-cell destruction) and Type 2 (insulin resistance and beta-cell dysfunction).

Management

Diet, exercise, glucose monitoring, and medications (insulin, metformin, etc.).

entries.title: Aspirin (Acetylsalicylic acid)
entries.summary: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for pain, fever, inflammation, and antiplatelet therapy.
entries.content:
Mechanism

Irreversibly inhibits cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes, reducing prostaglandin and thromboxane synthesis.

Clinical use

Analgesic, antipyretic, anti-inflammatory, and low-dose antiplatelet for cardiovascular prevention.

entries.title: Mitophagy
entries.summary: Selective autophagic clearance of damaged mitochondria to maintain cellular homeostasis.
entries.content: Mitophagy removes dysfunctional mitochondria through autophagosomes that fuse with lysosomes.
